intro: Synoptera, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. Synoptera is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
